history.content:
Unless you wanted to appeal, you'd need to get an A- in one of 61b/70 and a B+ in the other. Appealing is possible if you have a good story/CS ECs and LoR.

-------------

The above is incorrect; you can get a B+ in all three classes (CS 70, 61B, and 61A) and be right at the 3.3 cutoff and declare.

-------------

Above is incorrect since OP got a B and not a B+.

-------------

"Can  I declare cs with B+ in cs70 and cs61B and a B+ in cs61a." The answer to this (word for word) is yes.

-------------

Unless you wanted to appeal, you'd need to get an A- in one of 61b/70 and a B+ in the other. Appealing is possible if you have a good story/CS ECs and LoR.

Unless you wanted to appeal, you'd need to get an A- in one of 61b/70 and a B+ in the other. Appealing is possible if you have a good story/CS ECs and LoR.

children.subject: Yes, a B in 61A is not the end

With a 3.23, appeals sometimes results in an acceptance.  You would need to start of with a good LOR(s) and then write an essay.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/major-declaration-appeal
I'd try my best to get at least that B+ in 61a. However, if you end up with a B it is not the end of the world, but you'll have to be cautious not to bomb a midterm for cs 70 or 61b

history.content:
Hi Guys,

              I might get B in cs61a . Can  I declare cs with B+ in cs70 and cs61B and a B+ in cs61a. Has anybody declared CS with these grades.  I really wanna declare cs!!

                                                                                          Thank you!!
history.subject: Can i declare CS
